thread.title: Towns, Wiggins dominate for Wolves in win over Kings
thread.title_full: Towns, Wiggins dominate for Wolves in win over Kings

title: Towns, Wiggins dominate for Wolves in win over Kings
text:
Feb 28, 2017 at 1:04a ET 0Shares 
SACRAMENTO, Calif. â€” Karl-Anthony Towns had 29 points and 17 rebounds, Andrew Wiggins scored 27 points and the Minnesota Timberwolves beat the Sacramento Kings 102-88 on Monday night. 
Ricky Rubio had nine points and 11 assists to help the Timberwolves move within one game of the Kings as both teams try to catch Denver for the eighth spot in the West. 
Towns and Wiggins were dominant against the Kings, who had beaten the Wolves handily in the first two games between the teams this season. 
Towns shot 13 of 19 from the floor and sparked a big run in the second quarter when Minnesota took control. Wiggins exploited a size advantage against Sacramento and repeatedly scored inside. 
Kosta Koufos had 14 points and 11 rebounds for Sacramento. The Kings are 1-2 since trading All-Star DeMarcus Cousins to New Orleans during the All-Star break. 0
